conclusion: Predict which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles.
Liquid from A flows straight down and hits the blue baffle.
Liquid from B flows straight down and hits the cyan baffle.
Liquid from C flows straight down and hits the red baffle.
Liquid from D flows straight down and hits the orange baffle.
Liquid from A flows to the left after hitting the blue baffle and moves toward container E.
Liquid from B flows to the left after hitting the cyan baffle, then hits the black baffle, which redirects it further left toward container E.
Liquid from C flows to the right after hitting the red baffle, then hits the purple baffle, which redirects it further right toward container F.
Liquid from D flows to the right after hitting the orange baffle and moves directly toward container F.
Liquids from A and B are redirected toward E.
Liquids from C and D are redirected toward F.
Container E will collect liquid from A and B.
Container F will collect liquid from C and D.
